intro: Coccocypselum metallicum, commonly known as the metallic coccocypselum, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, ovate leaves. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
